---
title: "API Reference"
---

AlphaLab provides two main entry points for alpha research:

## Core API

| Module | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| [AlphaLabClient](client.qmd) | Main client for data access and alpha evaluation with auto-loading |
| [Standalone DSL](dsl.qmd) | Evaluate expressions on custom DataFrames |
| [Operators](operators.qmd) | 68 operators: time-series, cross-sectional, group, logical |

## Quick Comparison

```python
from alphalab.api.client import AlphaLabClient
from alphalab.api.dsl import compute

# Option 1: AlphaLabClient (auto-loads data)
client = AlphaLabClient(data_path="/path/to/data")
alpha = client.query("rank(-ts_delta(close, 5))")

# Option 2: Standalone DSL (custom DataFrames)
alpha = compute("rank(-ts_delta(x, 5))", x=my_price_df)
```

## When to Use Which

| Use Case | API |
|----------|-----|
| Working with AlphaLab data | `client.query()` |
| Custom external data | `dsl.compute()` |
| Need date/symbol filtering | `client.query()` or `client.get()` |
| Quick expression testing | `dsl.compute()` |

## Data Flow

```
AlphaLabClient
    ├── get(field)      → Load pre-built features
    ├── query(expr)     → Auto-load + evaluate
    └── lookup(symbol)  → Security master lookup

dsl.compute(expr, **vars)
    └── Evaluate on user-provided DataFrames
```
